alert.note: Alert for Northampton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 08 at 2:49PM EDT until April 10 at 7:01AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Jersey...Pennsylvania... Delaware River At Easton-Phillipsburg affecting Northampton, Hunterdon, and Warren Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Delaware River At Easton-Phillipsburg. * WHEN...From this evening to Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Backwater from the Delaware causes flooding in Easton along the Lehigh River At 20.0 feet, Minor flooding begins upstream in Harmony Station New Jersey and Sandts Eddy Pennsylvania. At 24.0 feet, Larry Holmes Drive in Easton is subject to flooding. Riverside Way in Phillipsburg is flooded in the area of the boat ramp. At 25.0 feet, Portions of Bushkill Drive and Route 611 are flooded due to a combination of Delaware River flooding and backwater effects on Bushkill Creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM EDT Friday the stage was 19.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 24.3 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 25.2 feet on 08/29/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (2 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Stg Time Date Delaware River Easton-Phillips 22.0 19.3 Fri 2 pm 23.9 19.6 24.3 8am 4/09 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 300 AM EDT.
